body:
@joel5638 multiscale is only used during training, not testing. 

You're testing on too large a fraction of images. Best practice is to use roughly 80 20 split. This may also speed up your overall training.
@joel5638 also you can skip testing alltogethor except the last epoch by using --notest
@glenn-jocher oh okay. But by skipping the testing for all the epochs. We do not get the map scores, do we?

@joel5638 if you use --notest then testing is only performed after training is over. So you would only get the final mAP.

If you want to keep computing mAP just reduce your test set.

@joel5638 ah that's interesting. There is a `multi_label` flag that is enabled after the first 3 epochs when testing that could be the cause of this. In coco this results in higher mAPs, but also increases the testing time a bit, maybe from 1:30 to 1:50 per epoch. You could try disabling it here by hard coding `multi_label = False`. How many classes do you have?
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/cf7a4d31d37788023a9186a1a143a2dab0275ead/train.py#L318
Who knows. You have to look at your train*.jpg, test*.jpg to verify your labels, and then plot your results.png file to view your trends. You need a good ML guy to read the tea leaves too.

@glenn-jocher oh okay sure Glenn. Thanks for this. Helps better

And btw, i have 7 classes. Weâ€™re training on 7classes.

I just remembered one more thing. NMS has timing logic which forces a premature exit if the process is taking too long. You might want to see if this is happening to you by putting a print() command in here, and maybe disabling it for a more accurate mAP, though this would be slower still of course:
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/cf7a4d31d37788023a9186a1a143a2dab0275ead/utils/utils.py#L539-L541

Time limit is 10 seconds per batch:
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/cf7a4d31d37788023a9186a1a143a2dab0275ead/utils/utils.py#L479
@glenn-jocher I would like to know whether the model used for testing is the same model in the different scales you give for model performance?
